In that case, you'll want an umbrella that's even more compact and lightweight to fit your backpack's small side pocket. Yes, there are umbrellas specifically designed for backpackers and hikers that are designed to be super compact and lightweight. Here are a few options:

1. Silnylon Umbrella by Sea to Summit: This umbrella is designed for backpackers and hikers, weighing only 6.7 oz (190g) and measuring 10.2 inches (26 cm) long when closed. It's made of silnylon, a lightweight and water-resistant material.
2. MSR Elixir Umbrella: This umbrella is designed for backpackers and outdoor enthusiasts, weighing 7.2 oz (204g) and measuring 10.5 inches (27 cm) long when closed. It has a compact design and a windproof frame.
3. Big Agnes Fly Creek Umbrella: This umbrella is designed for backpackers and campers, weighing 8.8 oz (250g) and measuring 11.5 inches (29 cm) long when closed. It has a compact design and a windproof frame.
4. REI Co-op Compact Umbrella: This umbrella is designed for backpackers and outdoor enthusiasts, weighing 7.4 oz (210g) and measuring 10.5 inches (27 cm) long when closed. It has a compact design and a windproof frame.

These umbrellas are designed to be super compact and lightweight, making them perfect for backpackers and hikers. They're also often made with durable and water-resistant materials to withstand the elements.

When shopping for a compact umbrella, look for features like:

* Weight: Look for umbrellas that weigh less than 10 oz (280g) for maximum portability.
* Length: Opt for umbrellas that are less than 12 inches (30 cm) long when closed to ensure they fit in your backpack's side pocket.
* Material: Look for lightweight and water-resistant materials like silnylon, nylon, or polyester.
* Windproof frame: A windproof frame will help keep the umbrella stable in strong winds.

Remember to always check the product dimensions and reviews to ensure the umbrella fits your backpack's side pocket and meets your needs.
